author: J.C. Shelton
title: College Football Powerhouse Surges To No. 1 in Updated Recruiting Rankings After 5-Star Addition
text:
There is a new No. 1 in class of 2026 college football recruiting rankings after a massive commitment on Wednesday.
Head coach Lincoln Riley and the USC Trojans previously held the top spot after jumping the Oregon Ducks on March 10. However, USC's lead was short lived, as five-star wide receiver Tristen Key's commitment has shaken things up atop the rankings.
Keys plays for Hattiesburg (Mississippi) High School. The 6-foot-2.5, 185-pound wideout is rated as the No. 1 wide receiver, the No. 1 player in the state and the No. 3 recruit overall, per On3 composite rankings.
Multiple college football powerhouses were in the hunt for a pledge from Keys before Wednesday's announcement, including LSU, Alabama, Miami, Texas A&M and Tennessee.
But it was the Tigers and head coach Brian Kelly that received the good news from Keys, who committed to LSU as the latest highly-coveted wide receiver to join the fold in Baton Rouge.
Despite having only seven commitments, including Keys, LSU's 2026 class has jumped USC for the No. 1 spot (On3). The Trojans hold the most commitments in the nation with 15.
BREAKING: Five-Star WR Tristen Keys has Committed to LSU, he tells me for
— Hayes Fawcett (@Hayesfawcett3)[@on3recruits]
The No. 1 WR in the ‘26 Class chose the Tigers over Tennessee, Alabama, & Texas A&M
“Once A Tiger, Always A Tiger[#WRTS]”[https://t.co/r9n15cVAMP][pic.twitter.com/HhGoLRPYLA][March 19, 2025]
Kelly and Co. appear to have kept momentum rolling after signing the No. 9 class in the 2025 cycle, as the Tigers currently hold the lead over USC, Oregon, Texas A&M and Auburn for 2026.
While there is still a wealth of time left in the cycle, LSU contending for the nation's top class is a welcomed sign for Tigers' faithful after a four-loss season in 2024.
LSU began spring practice last week and will culminate the period with a practice open to fans on April 12.
The Tigers will open the 2025 season at Clemson on Aug. 30.

author: The Conversation
title: La llegada inminente de La Niña plantea preocupaciones para una potencialmente peligrosa temporada de huracanes en el Atlántico | Noticias de México | El Imparcial
text: La llegada inminente de La Niña plantea preocupaciones para una potencialmente peligrosa temporada de huracanes en el Atlántico El impacto de La Niña se extiende a nivel global, afectando patrones de precipitación y condiciones climáticas extremas. A medida que el planeta se prepara para la transición de El Niño a La Niña, la perspectiva climática sigue siendo incierta, especialmente para las regiones vulnerables a eventos climáticos extremos. La Niña, la fase opuesta del patrón climático recurrente, está próxima, y sus implicaciones son profundas, especialmente para aquellos que residen a lo largo de las costas del Atlántico y del Golfo de los Estados Unidos. Pedro DiNezio, un científico de la atmósfera y el océano en la Universidad de Colorado, arroja luz sobre el cambio inminente y sus posibles ramificaciones. La Niña se manifiesta cuando las temperaturas en el océano Pacífico oriental descienden, preparando el escenario para trastornos atmosféricos con consecuencias de largo alcance. Te puede interesar: [¿Cuándo inicia la temporada de huracanes de este año en México?](https://www.elimparcial.com/mexico/2024/05/08/temporada-de-huracanes-en-mexico-2024/) Este fenómeno climático, caracterizado por patrones de circulación atmosférica intensificados como la Circulación de Walker y alteraciones en la trayectoria de la corriente en chorro, ejerce una influencia significativa en los sistemas climáticos globales. Durante La Niña, emergen condiciones más tormentosas en ciertas regiones mientras que otras lidian con una aridez intensificada, estableciendo el escenario para una interacción compleja de extremos climáticos. La Niña y sus consecuencias climáticas: lo que debes saber De particular preocupación es el impacto de La Niña en la actividad de huracanes en la cuenca del Atlántico. Con la disminución del cizallamiento del viento, los huracanes tienen un entorno propicio para su formación e intensificación, lo que representa amenazas inminentes para las comunidades costeras que ya están sufriendo las consecuencias de temporadas de tormentas anteriores. Además, las repercusiones se extienden más allá del ámbito de los ciclones tropicales. La influencia de La Niña en los patrones de precipitación puede exacerbar las condiciones de sequía en el suroeste de Estados Unidos, lo que potencialmente lleva a escasez de agua y aumenta los riesgos de incendios forestales. En el hemisferio sur, se desarrolla un conjunto contrastante de anomalías climáticas, con regiones como Chile y Argentina enfrentando condiciones de sequía mientras que otras, como el Amazonas y partes de Australia, luchan contra el exceso de lluvias e inundaciones. Complicando estos desafíos está la superposición del calentamiento global, que amplifica la intensidad y la frecuencia de eventos climáticos extremos. Si bien La Niña puede mitigar temporalmente el aumento de las temperaturas, el avance inexorable del cambio climático subraya la necesidad urgente de tomar medidas concertadas para mitigar sus impactos. A medida que el mundo se prepara para el inicio de La Niña y sus efectos cascada, la vigilancia, la preparación y las medidas proactivas son imperativas para proteger a las comunidades vulnerables y mitigar la amenaza inminente de desastres inducidos por el clima. Artículo [original ](https://theconversation.com/la-nina-is-coming-raising-the-chances-of-a-dangerous-atlantic-hurricane-season-an-atmospheric-scientist-explains-this-climate-phenomenon-228595)publicado en The Conversation

author: VNExplorer
title: Operation Blue Star anniversary marked by pro-Khalistan slogans at Golden Temple
text: Operation Blue Star anniversary marked by pro-Khalistan slogans at Golden Temple On the 40th anniversary of Operation Blue Star in the north Indian state of Punjab, some members of the Sikh community on Thursday (June 6) raised pro-Khalistan slogans within the Golden Temple complex in Amritsar, the site of the military operation to weed out separatists. Posters of Jarnail Singh Bhindranwale, the prominent Khalistani separatist at the time, were also seen during the demonstration. Blue Star Operation Indian Army's ‘Blue Star Operation’ began on June 1, 1984. The operation was carried out to eliminate Jarnail Singh Bhindranwale, who had taken shelter in the Golden Temple. × The then Prime Minister Indira Gandhi had approved the operation, which had a massive repercussion, leading to violent communal clashes. The operation took place from June 1 to June 10, 1984. Security beefed up in Amritsar The Punjab police have beefed up security across Amritsar in order to prevent any unforeseen incidents. The police have deployed around 2,300 jawans to guard Amritsar City. This includes two companies of the BSF, one of the CRPF, as well as 1,000 anti-riot police personnel, and officers from neighbouring districts, said a police spokesperson. Security forces have been deployed throughout Amritsar, with checkpoints established on roads leading to the Golden Temple and SGPC task force personnel bolstering security within the complex. The Dal Khalsa organised a procession in memory of those who lost their lives during Operation Blue Star, referring to it as a "holocaust remembrance" parade. The radical group also announced a call for an Amritsar Bandh on June 6. The occasion also came in the wake of the overwhelming election victories of detained radical Sikh leader Amritpal Singh and Sarabjeet Singh Khalsa, the son of Beant Singh, one of the assassins of former PM Indira Gandhi. (With inputs from agencies)

author: NPT Staff
title: Agreement Signed For New National Park Reserve In Prince Edward Island
text:
Prince Edward Island is getting a new national park reserve thanks to an agreement signed this week. The creation of
Pituamkek National Park Reserve will be the first national park reserve to contribute to Canada’s commitment to create 10 new national parks by 2026.
Comprised of a chain of barrier islands in northwestern PEI, the lands of Pituamkek (bee-DOO-um-gek) form one of the most ecologically significant coastal dune ecosystems in eastern Canada and hold great cultural and historical significance for the Epekwitnewaq Mi’kmaq, the Mi’kmaq of Epekwitk and island residents.
The archipelago also helps mitigate the impacts of extreme weather events on coastal communities, as seen during Hurricane Fiona in September 2022. The Traveler got
a private preview of the island near the Lennox Island First Nation in northwestern PEI in June 2022. This will be Canada's 48th national park.
The establishment agreement was announced Thursday by Mi’kmawey Kapmnt Ta’n Nikana’tu’tij Epekwitnewaq Mi’kmaw-Saqmaq — the Mi’kmaw Nation Government of Prince Edward Island (as represented by the Prince Edward Island Chiefs), Chief Darlene Bernard of Lennox Island First Nation, Chief Junior Gould of Abegweit First Nation, and Steven Guilbeault, Minister of Environment and Climate Change and Minister responsible for Parks Canada.
Pituamkek — “At the Long Sand Dune” — is home to ancient and continuing Mi’kmaw land-use traditions, important cultural and archaeological sites, rare and sensitive ecosystems, and unique geological formations. It boasts coastal dune systems, old-growth forests and PEI’s only igneous rock incursion.
The agreement lays out key elements of the future park reserve, such as a co-management governance model, guardian programming, community-based employment opportunities, and commitments for net-zero, climate smart infrastructure development. It builds on Canada’s commitment to reconciliation with Indigenous peoples and a renewed government-to-government relationship with the Epekwitnewaq Mi’kmaq.
The work on assembling the park reserve lands is an ongoing partnership between L‘nuey, Parks Canada, Island Nature Trust, the Nature Conservancy of Canada and the Province of Prince Edward Island. The Mi’kmaq Epekwitnewaq Kapmntemuow has led the way in initiating and continuously advocating for the establishment of this park reserve since the beginning of this process in 2006.
Parks Canada explains that a national park reserve is an area that is managed like a national park but is subject to one or more Indigenous land claims. These land claims are being negotiated between the federal and Indigenous governments. Indigenous peoples continue to use the land for traditional hunting, fishing and trapping.

organizations.name: agreement signed for new national park reserve

author: Mairead Sheehy and Alison O'Reilly
title: Irish-Palestinian citizen Zak Hania to be reunited with family in Ireland this weekend
text: An Irish-Palestinian man who was trapped in war-torn Gaza for months will be reunited with his family in Ireland this weekend. Zak Hania has finally fled Rafah almost six months after his family made the move back to Ireland. His family has been campaigning for his return ever since they arrived in Dublin. The Hania family were among 28 Irish citizens who were evacuated in November by the Department of Foreign Affairs via Cairo to Dublin. The three brothers and mother had walked for days, making two long journeys from north Gaza to the Rafah Crossing, between Egypt and the Gaza Strip. His wife Batoul Hania said her husband is now in Egypt and is expected to arrive in Dublin tomorrow. It has been a long time coming for the Hania family, who had hoped to be reunited with their father in time for Christmas last year. “He is still back there, and we wait for news every day,” Mazen Hania told the Irish Examiner in December. “We don’t know why he was not on the list, he is an Irish citizen, so every day we don’t know if he will live or if he will die. We want to have all the family here, and safe. “We have left everything behind, but we want our father here, for Christmas and for our family to be together. “It’s like we left him there to die. The situation over there is like something you can’t even imagine.” Mrs Hania said despite the threat to their lives, fleeing Gaza was one of the most difficult decisions she has ever been faced with — when she was forced to walk away from her husband who could not leave. “I was screaming, ‘I can’t go’, but my husband and his family said ‘you have to go, just go’,” she said.

author: Eduardo Mendoza
title: Clima México 29 de diciembre 2023: Frente Frío 20 seguirá causando estragos en el país
text: [Clima México](https://www.sdpnoticias.com/mexico/frente-frio-20-en-mexico-hoy-28-de-diciembre-masa-de-aire-polar-seguira-expandiendose-checa-los-estados-congelados/) 29 de diciembre 2023: El Servicio Meteorológico Nacional (SMN), a través de Conagua, informó que el Frente Frío 20 seguirá causando estragos en el país. De acuerdo con la dependencia, este viernes se espera caída de aguanieve en algunas zonas del país, por lo que es importante estar bien preparados para las bajas temperaturas. El Frente Frío 20 se mantendrá en la zona sureste y noreste del país, por lo que sus efectos afectarán de manera directa a esta región, principalmente la Península del estado de Yucatán. [Clima CDMX: Activan alerta amarrilla en 6 alcaldías por frío para el miércoles 27 de diciembre](/estados/cdmx/clima-cdmx-activan-alerta-amarrilla-en-6-alcaldias-por-bajas-temperaturas-para-el-miercoles-27-de-diciembre/) [Cobertores de Paw Patrol: Precios de los 6 modelos más bonitos que te salvarán del frío](/estilo-de-vida/cobertores-de-paw-patrol-precios-de-los-6-modelos-mas-bonitos-que-te-salvaran-del-frio/) [Solsticio de Invierno: ¿A qué hora entra el invierno 2023 en México?](/estilo-de-vida/solsticio-de-invierno-a-que-hora-entra-el-invierno-2023-en-mexico/) [¿Qué es un invierno atípico? 5 características del clima que experimentaremos en México](/estilo-de-vida/que-es-un-invierno-atipico-5-caracteristicas-del-clima-que-experimentaremos-en-mexico/) Frente Frío 20 provocará caída de aguanieve este 29 de diciembre 2023 El SMN, alertó que el Frente Frío 20, alimentando por una masa de aire polar proveniente del norte de México, alimentará las condiciones del fenómeno Norte en la zona del Golfo de México, afectando a la Península de Yucatán y la zona del Golfo e Istmo de Tehuantepec. Asimismo, provocará caída de aguanieve este 29 de diciembre 2023 en: - Sierra del sureste de Coahuila, en Sierra de Arteaga - Nuevo León (zona sur) - Tamaulipas (zona suroeste) - San Luis Potosí (zona norte) Asimismo, en algunas zonas altas, como las regiones montañosas que superan los 3 mil metros de altitud, se prevé caída de aguanieve a nieve: - Pico de Orizaba - Cofre de Perote - La Malinche - Popocatépetl - Iztaccíhuatl CDMX y Edomex con temperatura gélida para este 29 de diciembre 2023 Asimismo, el SMN alertó que la CDMX y Edomex tendrán temperaturas gélidas para este viernes 29 de diciembre 2023. Se espera que en la zona del Valle de México persista el clima muy frío a frío, que propicie la generación de bancos de niebla y un cielo medio nublado en ambas entidades. Las estimaciones apuntan una temperatura de -1 a 1 °C en la zona de Toluca, con una posible máxima de 15 a 17 °C. En tanto, para la CDMX, se esperan temperaturas que vayan de 0 a los 5°C. De igual forma, Conagua Clima indicó la posibilidad de lluvias muy fuertes en: - Campeche - Chiapas - Oaxaca - Puebla - Quintana Roo - Tabasco - Veracruz

author: @Masrawy
title: أول رد من تعليم الغربية على واقعة "سماعة الغش" في المحلة | مصراوى
text:
الغربية – مروة شاهين:
نفت مديرية التربية والتعليم بمحافظة الغربية ما تردد عبر مواقع التواصل الاجتماعي بشأن ضبط طالبة بلجنة ثانوية بمدينة المحلة الكبرى وبحوزتها سماعة بلوتوث لاستخدامها في الغش، مؤكدة أن ما يتم تداوله مجرد شائعات لا أساس لها من الصحة تهدف إلى إثارة البلبلة.
وكان رواد منصات التواصل قد تداولوا منشورات تزعم أن الطالبة استُوقفت أثناء تفتيشها قبل دخول اللجنة، وأنها استغاثت بوالدها الذي كان يعاونها في محاولة الغش، إلا أنه لاذ بالفرار بمجرد افتضاح الأمر.
من جهتها، أكدت مديرية التربية والتعليم على لسان مصدر مسؤول، أن غرفة العمليات لم تتلق أي بلاغات رسمية تتعلق بهذه الواقعة، مشددة على أن جميع لجان الثانوية العامة تخضع لرقابة مشددة وتسيّر أعمالها بشكل طبيعي ومنضبط دون أي مشكلات تُذكر.
ودعت المديرية إلى تحري الدقة في تداول المعلومات، وعدم الانسياق وراء الشائعات أو المساهمة في نشرها، مطالبة باستقاء الأخبار من المصادر الرسمية المعتمدة فقط.

author: Maxwell Mutuma
title: Judge Approves Celsius Network’s Shift to Bitcoin Mining Company
text: Celsius Network, the embattled cryptocurrency lender, has received court approval for a revised [bankruptcy exit plan](https://coingape.com/what-celsius-is-doing-to-prevent-bankruptcy/). This new strategy pivots from its initial arrangement with the Fahrenheit consortium, focusing instead on establishing a standalone Bitcoin mining enterprise. The decision, sanctioned by Judge Martin Glenn on December 27, follows the United States Securities and Exchange Commission’s (SEC) rejection of the earlier proposed deal involving the creation of NewCo, a diverse business entity managed by the Fahrenheit consortium. Shift in Exit Strategy Due to Regulatory Hurdles The initial exit plan, which envisioned the formation of NewCo to expand Celsius’ mining and business operations under [Fahrenheit consortium](https://coingape.com/fahrenheit-wins-celsius-network-bid-new-company/)‘s management, hit a roadblock with the SEC’s refusal to grant necessary approvals. This consortium included prominent crypto entities like Proof Group, Arrington Capital, and Hut 8. However, with the SEC’s denial, Celsius, backed by its creditors, opted for an alternative route previously agreed upon – transitioning towards a public company solely focused on Bitcoin mining. This change in strategy is significant as it implies a narrower focus for the company’s future endeavors. The creation of this Bitcoin-centric firm marks a distinct move away from the diverse business model proposed earlier. Creditors are set to receive part of their recovery through shares in the upcoming Bitcoin mining entity. Moreover, this [ new direction allows](https://cases.stretto.com/public/x191/11749/PLEADINGS/117491227238 115.pdf) the release of $225 million in crypto assets, initially earmarked for the now-rejected business ventures. Implications for Creditors and the Future of Celsius Under the new plan, approximately $2 billion in Bitcoin and Ethereum will be redistributed to the creditors of Celsius. This decision is a crucial aspect of the company’s strategy to address the financial claims of those affected by its bankruptcy. The plan’s approval came despite some creditors and the U.S. Department of Justice’s bankruptcy watchdog advocating for a re-vote on the proposal. However, Judge Glenn determined that this new restructuring strategy falls within the terms of the previously confirmed plan and does not adversely affect the creditors’ interests. The move to focus solely on Bitcoin mining indicates a strategic pivot for Celsius, reflecting the company’s adaptation to regulatory challenges and market conditions. This strategy also highlights the evolving landscape of cryptocurrency businesses, where adaptability and compliance with regulatory standards are becoming increasingly crucial. Recommended Articles Celsius Network’s [ bankruptcy filing](https://coingape.com/is-celsius-next-to-file-bankruptcy-after-voyager-three-arrows/) in July 2022 marked a significant downturn for the company, which was once a prominent player in crypto lending. The arrest of its former CEO, [Alex Mashinsky](https://coingape.com/alex-mashinsky-arrested-as-us-sec-doj-cftc-filed-lawsuit-against-celsius-network/), in July 2023 on charges of securities fraud, commodities fraud, and wire fraud, further complicated the company’s situation. The new exit strategy represents a critical step in Celsius’ efforts to navigate its financial difficulties and reestablish itself in the cryptocurrency industry.
